name: Semiperimeter of the unique primitive Pythagorean triple (a,b,c) such that (a-b+c)/2 is A000032(n) and such that its long leg and its hypotenuse are consecutive natural numbers.
reference: Miguel Ángel Pérez García-Ortega, José Manuel Sánchez Muñoz and José Miguel Blanco Casado, El Libro de las Ternas Pitagóricas, Preprint 2025.
link: Miguel-Ángel Pérez García-Ortega, El Libro de las Ternas Pitagóricas
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (3,1,-5,-1,1).
example: For n=3, the short leg is A382379(2,1) = 5, the long leg is A382379(2,2) = 12 and the hypotenuse is A382379(2,3) = 13 so the semiperimeter is then a(3) = (5 + 12 + 13)/2 = 15.
author: _Miguel-Ángel Pérez García-Ortega_, Mar 24 2025

name: Table read by rows: row n is the unique primitive Pythagorean triple (a,b,c) such that (a-b+c)/2 is A000032(n) and such that its long leg and its hypotenuse are consecutive natural numbers.
comment: Row n=1 is included by convention and corresponds to the Pythagorean triple 1^2 + 0^2 = 1^2.
reference: Miguel Ángel Pérez García-Ortega, José Manuel Sánchez Muñoz and José Miguel Blanco Casado, El Libro de las Ternas Pitagóricas, Preprint 2025.
link: Miguel-Ángel Pérez García-Ortega, El Libro de las Ternas Pitagóricas

author: _Miguel-Ángel Pérez García-Ortega_, Mar 24 2025

name: Area of the unique primitive Pythagorean triple (a,b,c) such that (a-b+c)/2 is A000032(n) and such that its long leg and its hypotenuse are consecutive natural numbers.
reference: Miguel Ángel Pérez García-Ortega, José Manuel Sánchez Muñoz and José Miguel Blanco Casado, El Libro de las Ternas Pitagóricas, Preprint 2025.
link: Miguel-Ángel Pérez García-Ortega, El Libro de las Ternas Pitagóricas
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (6,-2,-29,16,40,-11,-14,2,1).
example: For n=3, the short leg is A382379(2,1) = 5 and the long leg is A382379(2,2) = 12  so the area is then a(3) = (5 * 12)/2 = 30.
author: _Miguel-Ángel Pérez García-Ortega_, Mar 24 2025
